results.title: Stealing beauty
results.creator_credit: Bernardo Bertolucci, Jeremy Thomas, Fox Searchlight, UGC Images and Recorded Picture Company
results.brief_description: Nineteen-year-old Lucy (Liv Tyler) goes to stay in the Tuscan countryside with old friends of her late mother. This is a time of discovery for Lucy: inspired by the free-spirit of the bohemian characters who take special interest in her virginity (or loss of), she explores a romance with a local Italian boy. Her mentor is Alex (Jeremy Irons), who is a writer on the brink of death. Bertolucci is pre-occupied with aesthetics in this film and the focus is very much on the beauty of the Tuscan countryside, and of Liv Tyler. Cast includes Sinead Cusack, Jean Marais, Donal McCann, Stefania Sandrelli, Joseph Fiennes.

results.title: Steady as she goes
results.creator_credit: Robert Fresco, Sharon Lee Chapelle and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: George Fulfit, retired, illustrates with humor and optimism the delicate craft of putting ships into bottles. The film documents the construction of the largest ship he has ever built. More than a “how-to” film, this short documentary shows the very real contribution a craft can make to anyone’s life, whether a child, or a working or retired person. (Awards: Toronto; New York; Columbus; Yorkton; Carbondale; Toulon.)

results.title: Starship troopers
results.creator_credit: Paul Verhoeven, Jon Davison, Alan Marshall, Tri-Star Pictures and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Presented as an enthusiastic, squeaky clean propaganda/soap opera style film, this highly satirical work from director Paul Verhoeven is an effective political comment on militaristic and colonialistic driven societies. Johnny Rico (Casper Van Dien) and his unquestioningly patriotic friends; recent graduates of the Buenos Aires High School, join the Federation forces in a mission to the home planet of an alien bug race that threatens life on earth. What follows is an amazing epic science fiction adventure complete with love triangle, mock news flashes, schlock battle sequences and seamless special effects as the all too mannequin-like characters attempt to overcome their vicious bug enemies. Cast includes Casper Van Dien, Denise Richards, Jake Busey, Neil Patrick Harris, Patrick Muldoon and Michael Ironside. Based on the book by Robert A. Heinlein.

results.title: Staying upfront
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Michael Rubetzki and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This is a film about a long distance owner truck driver and his family. The reasons why he became an owner-driver are explored as well as the rewards he gets from it, and the effect on his family of operating in a high pressure, often marginal income industry.

results.title: Starman
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Larry Franco and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: An alien (Jeff Bridges) makes a stopover on earth when he encounters the Voyager 2 probe. By masquerading as a human he has the opportunity, if only for a little while, to live like an ordinary man. His arrival is quickly discovered by a young woman (Karen Allen) who develops feelings for the Starman and agrees to assist him in the 2000 mile journey it will take him to get home. Cast includes Charles Martin Smith and Richard Jaeckel.

results.title: Staying alive show (episodes 1, 2 & 3)
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Orr, Lyndall Horton-Jones, David Ferris and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: An entertaining video which reinforces the traffic safety message for children in the early to middle primary years. Using the format of a popular TV game show, contestants are qizzed on the do’s and don’ts of pedestrian and passenger safety.

results.title: Status = Status anxiety
results.creator_credit: James Runcie, Neil Crombie and Channel Four Television Corporation
results.brief_description: Alain de Botton presents this three-part documentary series which is an exploration of the modern dilemma of how work and objects define a person’s status in western society. Are we cash rich but spiritually poor? Does wealth equate to happiness? Why do we worry so much about what people think of us? Alain de Botton has a interesting take on this resulting in thought provoking television through the use of contemporary interviews mixed with some views of ancient philosophers brought into the contemporary context. He also talks to people with an alternative view, such as naturists and bohemians, to find out their understanding of ‘status’. Another interesting series by the same presenter is “Philosophy: a guide to happiness” [318970]. Written by Alain de Botton.

results.title: Stations
results.brief_description: A story, set in Brisbane in 1953, about a young woman who falls in love and becomes pregnant. What follows is a painful and deliberate account of women’s resilience in the face of the dilemmas and social constraints of Australia in the fifties. Stars Noni Hazelhurst and Tim Burns.

results.title: Station in life
results.creator_credit: John Gordon, Frank Torley and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Shows some of the daily activities on a sheep property in the New Zealand high country. Notes the effect of the climate on the husbandry practices at this station and the changes in land use due to soil erosion.

results.title: I am not alone
results.brief_description: In this original and stylish animation, a young man involved in a freak accident is catapaulted to the underworld where he is confronted with the prospect of his eternal existance after death.
